meanings.definition: Relating to the duties or activities of a conductor.
meanings.sent1: The conductorial skills of the music director were evident during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra followed the conductorial guidance with precision.
meanings.sent3: The conductorial approach of the maestro brought a touch of elegance to the concert.
meanings.sent4: Her conductorial presence on stage commanded attention like a symphony conductor.
meanings.sent5: The conductorial role requires a keen sense of timing and leadership.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the direction or management of an orchestra or other musical group.
meanings.sent1: The conductorial style of the orchestra's leader set the tone for the performance.
meanings.sent2: His conductorial expertise ensured a harmonious blend of musical elements.
meanings.sent3: The conductorial responsibilities of the band manager included scheduling rehearsals.
meanings.sent4: The conductor's conductorial finesse was akin to a skilled captain navigating a ship.
meanings.sent5: The conductorial duties involve coordinating musicians to create a cohesive sound.
